text: Johannes van Damme (1 June 1935 – 23 September 1994) was a Dutch engineer and businessman executed in Singapore for drug trafficking. He was the first European to be executed in Singapore since its independence. ==Biography== Van Damme had lived in Nigeria for a while and was married to a Nigerian woman at the time of his arrest. He was arrested on 27 September 1991, at Singapore Changi Airport. In a secret compartment of his trunk, of heroin was found. Van Damme claimed he had been framed by his Nigerian engineer partner, but this claim was rejected by the court. In November 1993, his appeal was rejected, and the sentence was upheld. A plea for clemency from the Dutch government was rejected by the President of Singapore, Ong Teng Cheong. A letter from Queen Beatrix was sent to the President in an unsuccessful attempt to prevent Van Damme from being executed.Last-ditch appeals fail to save drugs man from gallows, The Herald, 23 September 1994 He was hanged at Changi Prison on the morning of Friday, 23 September 1994, between 6:30 am and 7:00 am. His case, along with that of Mat Repin, executed by hanging on 13 May 1994 at Changi prison for having smuggled 1 kg of cannabis from Malaysia,Amnesty International Report 1995 – Singapore,) prompted science fiction author William Gibson to describe Singapore as Disneyland with the Death Penalty, the title of in his first major non-fiction piece which was first published by Wired magazine in its September/October 1993 issue (1.4). The Singapore government banned Wired upon the publication of the issue, and the phrase "Disneyland with the death penalty" became a byword for bland authoritarianism that the city-state could not easily discard. == See also == * Capital punishment for drug trafficking * Capital punishment in Singapore == References == Category:1935 births Category:1994 deaths Category:People executed by Singapore Category:Dutch expatriates in Nigeria Category:Executed Dutch people Category:People from Middelburg Category:Dutch drug traffickers Category:20th-century Dutch criminals Category:Dutch people executed abroad Category:20th-century executions by Singapore Category:People executed for drug offences Category:Dutch expatriates in Singapore Category:1991 crimes in Singapore
